channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nick Reiner's attorney removes himself from case
item.description: Defense attorney Alan Jackson said that circumstances beyond his and Reiner's control made it "impossible" to continue representation.

item.title: ICE agent fatally shoots woman in Minneapolis amid immigration crackdown
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security accused the victim of being a "rioter" and that the ICE officer who pulled the trigger was "fearing for his life."...

item.title: U.S. population growth is slowing. The immigration crackdown is a major factor
item.description: Congressional forecasters have lowered their projection for U.S. population growth over the next decade by 7 million people as a result of the Trump a...

item.title: Béla Fleck cancels Kennedy Center appearance, says it's become 'charged and political'
item.description: The 18-time Grammy Award winner is the latest musician to cancel an show at the Kennedy Center. Béla Fleck says he cannot currently perform there beca...

item.title: One year into an uneven recovery, L.A.'s fire survivors mark a somber milestone
item.description: The recovery from last year's deadly wildfires in Los Angeles has been slow and uneven for a lot of reasons, with survivors struggling to navigate a c...

item.title: UN rights chief says Israeli policy in West Bank 'resembles apartheid system'
item.description: Israel says Volker Türk's office makes "absurd" accusations in a report that details what the UN calls "systemic discrimination" against Palestinians.

item.title: Trump immigration policies and aging population slow US growth projection, budget office says
US seizes two 'shadow fleet' tankers linked to Venezuelan oil
item.description: The ships were boarded by US forces in predawn operations in the North Atlantic and the Caribbean Sea.

item.title: ICE officer fatally shoots woman in Minneapolis, investigation underway
item.description: An ICE officer fatally shot a woman Wednesday morning in south Minneapolis, according to the Department of Homeland Security. The victim was a 37-year...

item.title: What is the price of gold today?
item.description: Understanding the pricing trends and dynamics of the gold market is crucial for making sound financial choices.

item.title: Ohio police release video of person of interest in dentist and wife's killing
item.description: Investigators believe Spencer and Monique Tepe were fatally shot between 2 a.m. and 5 a.m. last Tuesday in their home located in the Near East Side ne...

item.title: ICE officer kills a Minneapolis driver as Trump’s latest immigration operation begins
item.description: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey says the Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer who shot and killed a motorist acted recklessly, and he rejected fed...

item.title: Trump actively discussing potentially buying Greenland, White House says
item.description: Both Greenland and its owner Denmark have repeatedly stressed the island was not for sale.

item.title: Trump says he'll ban large investors from buying single-family homes
item.description: President Trump said "people live in homes, not corporations," in announcing plans to bar big investors from home purchases.

item.title: How to file a refund claim in Amazon's $2.5 billion FTC settlement
item.description: Eligible Amazon customers can now request a refund from a settlement over allegations of deceptive Prime enrollment practices.

item.title: Cambodia extradites alleged scam mastermind to China after arrest
item.description: Chen Zhi is charged with turning his business into a front for fraud hubs that stole from people around the world.

item.title: How could Donald Trump 'take' Greenland?
item.description: The White House says it is considering a range of options to acquire the island, including deploying the military.

item.title: President Trump says his voters loved the Venezuela attack — here’s what they think
